abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory and project sustainability is likely. Both
            World Bank and Borrower performances are overall
            satisfactory. Lessons included the following: The pilot
            operation was very useful in setting in motion a major
            restructuring program--the mere fact that the pilot closure
            was successful was sufficient to trigger an accelerated mine
            closure program and thus substantially reduce the drain on
            the national budget. In deviating from the best practice
            norm, this project had several disbursement conditions for
            different components, allowing fast processing and early
            loan effectiveness, thus enabling the national economy to
            reap the benefits of fast restructuring. Also, when it
            became evident during implementation that micro-credits and
            employment subsidies were ineffective social mitigation
            measures at this time, the funds were shifted to public
            works which, beside the positive temporary employment, had
            added social benefits for the local public, and through the
            goodwill created, contributed to keeping the pace of mine
            closures. Triggered by difficulties met in financing social
            assets transfers and the need to provide incentives for such
            transfers and improve conditions in communities with closed
            mines, the Bank's supervision team, in close
            cooperation with the beneficiaries, developed the Municipal
            Credit Line. Procedures that could improve mine closures
            include sufficient preparation, splitting tasks, and
            tailoring the agency for mine closures.
